Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2012 12:34PM rosie15 wrote: Hi Mags Thank you so much for posting. I am definitely working on seeing a Dr. I searched online for free cancer screening and found one that I will call first thing Monday. I will update once I have been seen. Thank you again and wish you well.
Posts.Title: found a lump, want to hear/read about others experience rosie15 rosie15

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2012 08:20PM rosie15 wrote: Hi Elizabeth, I hope you are well. I had a question I wanted to please ask. I got my lump checked out. I actually got a biopsy and an ultrasound and thankfully the biopsy revealed benign. The Dr that performed the ultrasound said the lump was actually my rib that was palpated and right above that was a fibroadenoma (sp) which is a benign lump commonly found in younger women. When the Dr first told you your lump was just your bone, was that before or after an ultrasound/biopsy? I felt like a hypochondriac in front of the Dr and she was just trying to get me out. Thank you so much for your time, Elizabeth :)
Posts.Title: found a lump, want to hear/read about others experience rosie15 rosie15

Posts.Content: rosie15 wrote: Hi all, I never thought to search advice through forums until it really hit me that 'what if it really is something'.  I'm 32 (in 2 months) and have very small breasts.  After breastfeeding all 3 of my children, each for about 18 months I was not left with much and so about a few months ago I easily found a lump on my right breast.  It is against my rib and it could be easily mistaken as my rib but when I feel for symmetry, it's actually very asymmetric with my left breast.  When I examine it, it feels pretty hard, it doesn't really move.  When press four fingers around it like to form a rectangle, I could feel the lump move slightly.  I'm usually not a hypochondriac but the thought of leaving my young children early drives me to worry a lot more.  I'm a stay at home mom and my husband just started a rigorous one year nursing program so he had to go per diem at work, so we have no medical coverage.    (I've had an ovary removed due to a benign cyst the size of a softball growing on it about 6 years ago.)  I would love to hear about anyone's experiences about finding lumps.  I'd like to know the characteristics of the lumps.  Thank you in advance your time :) xx, rosie   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: found a lump, want to hear/read about others experience rosie15 rosie15
